Global

Captcha

Captcha

new Captcha()

Source:
  • captcha.js, line 24
Example
AV.Captcha.request({
  size: 6,
  ttl: 30,
}).then(captcha => {
  captcha.bind({
    textInput: 'code', // the id for textInput
    image: 'captcha',
    verifyButton: 'verify',
  }, {
    success: (validateCode) => {}, // next step
    fail: (error) => {}, // present error.message to user
  });
});

Methods

(static) request() → {Promise.<AV.Captcha>}

Source:
  • captcha.js, line 121
Request a captcha
Returns:
Type
Promise.<AV.Captcha>

bind()

Source:
  • captcha.js, line 59
Bind the captcha to HTMLElements. ONLY available in browser.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
elements.textInput String | HTMLInputElement <optional>
 An input element typed text, or the id for the element.
elements.image String | HTMLInputElement <optional>
 An image element, or the id for the element.
elements.verifyButton String | HTMLInputElement <optional>
 A button element, or the id for the element.
callbacks.success function <optional>
 success callback will be called if the code is verified. The param `validateCode` can be used for further SMS request.
callbacks.fail function <optional>
 fail callback will be called if something goes wrong, detailed in param `error.message`.

refresh() → {Promise.<string>}

Source:
  • captcha.js, line 32
Refresh the captcha
Returns:
a new capcha url
Type
Promise.<string>

unbind()

Source:
  • captcha.js, line 109
unbind the captcha to HTMLElements. ONLY available in browser.

verify() → {Promise.<string>}

Source:
  • captcha.js, line 45
Verify the captcha
Returns:
validateToken if the code is valid
Type
Promise.<string>
